title: Luna 1 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Luna 1, the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon and the first to orbit the Sun.

title: First US Weather Satellite
description: TIROS-4, the fourth Television Infrared Observation Satellite, was launched, marking a significant step in meteorological observation from space.

title: IRAS Telescope Launched
description: The Infrared Astronomical Satellite (IRAS) was launched, conducting the first all-sky survey at infrared wavelengths.

title: Pioneer 5 Launched
description: NASA launched Pioneer 5, a deep space probe designed to study the interplanetary magnetic field and solar flares.

title: Mars 3 Lander
description: The Soviet Mars 3 lander successfully soft-landed on Mars, becoming the first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Red Planet.

title: Spirit Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Spirit rover successfully landed on Mars, beginning its mission to explore the planet's geology and search for signs of past water activity.

title: Ranger 3 Launched
description: NASA launched Ranger 3, an uncrewed lunar probe intended to impact the Moon, though it missed its target.

title: First Black Hole Candidate
description: Cygnus X-1, a strong X-ray source, was identified as a likely black hole candidate, revolutionizing astrophysics.

title: Chang'e 4 Lands on Far Side of Moon
description: China's Chang'e 4 probe successfully made the first-ever soft landing on the far side of the Moon.

title: Sputnik 1 Reenters Atmosphere
description: The first artificial Earth satellite, Sputnik 1, launched by the Soviet Union, reentered Earth's atmosphere after 92 days in orbit.

title: Luna 9 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Luna 9, which would become the first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Moon.

title: Spirit Rover Begins Operations
description: After landing on Mars, the Spirit rover deployed its instruments and began transmitting its first images and data.

title: Space Shuttle Program Announced
description: President Richard Nixon announced the beginning of the Space Shuttle program, a new era of reusable spacecraft.

title: Discovery of Charon
description: James Christy discovered Charon, Pluto's largest moon, significantly changing our understanding of the dwarf planet system.

title: Deep Impact Launched
description: NASA launched the Deep Impact spacecraft, designed to study the interior of a comet by releasing an impactor into its nucleus.

title: Lunar Prospector Launched
description: NASA launched Lunar Prospector, a mission to map the Moon's surface composition and search for polar ice.

title: New Horizons Launched
description: NASA launched the New Horizons spacecraft, embarking on a historic journey to Pluto and the Kuiper Belt.

title: Kepler-10c Confirmed
description: Astronomers confirmed Kepler-10c, a 'mega-Earth' exoplanet, challenging theories of planet formation.

title: Galileo Discovers Jupiter's Moons
description: Galileo Galilei observed three of Jupiter's largest moons (Io, Europa, and Ganymede), a pivotal moment in astronomy.

title: Mars Polar Lander Launched
description: NASA launched the Mars Polar Lander, intended to study the Martian polar regions, though it was lost upon arrival.

title: Huygens Probe Separates from Cassini
description: The Huygens probe successfully separated from the Cassini orbiter, beginning its descent towards Saturn's moon Titan.

title: Stephen Hawking Born
description: Renowned theoretical physicist and cosmologist Stephen Hawking, known for his work on black holes and relativity, was born.

title: STS-54 Endeavour Launched
description: Space Shuttle Endeavour launched on mission STS-54, deploying a Tracking and Data Relay Satellite.

title: Huygens Probe Lands on Titan
description: The Huygens probe successfully landed on Titan, becoming the first spacecraft to land on a moon in the outer Solar System.

title: Surveyor 7 Launched
description: NASA launched Surveyor 7, the seventh and final lunar lander in the Surveyor program, which performed a soft landing near Tycho crater.

title: Skylab Workshop Begins
description: NASA announced the Skylab Workshop, inviting scientists to propose experiments for the upcoming space station.

title: Kepler-438b Discovered
description: NASA announced the discovery of Kepler-438b, a near-Earth-sized exoplanet orbiting within the habitable zone of its star.

title: First Radar Contact with Moon
description: The US Army Signal Corps Project Diana successfully made the first radar contact with the Moon, paving the way for space communication.

title: Soyuz 4 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Soyuz 4, which would perform the first docking of two crewed spacecraft and crew transfer in orbit.

title: Stardust Mission Flyby
description: NASA's Stardust spacecraft performed a close flyby of Comet Wild 2, collecting dust samples for return to Earth.

title: ISEE-3 Launched
description: NASA launched ISEE-3 (International Sun-Earth Explorer 3), the first spacecraft to be placed in a halo orbit at the L1 Lagrangian point.

title: First Woman to Walk in Space
description: Svetlana Savitskaya became the first woman to perform a spacewalk during the Soyuz T-12 mission.

title: China's Anti-Satellite Missile Test
description: China conducted an anti-satellite missile test, destroying its own defunct weather satellite, raising concerns about space debris.

title: Gemini 12 Launched
description: NASA launched Gemini 12, the final crewed mission of the Gemini program, focusing on rendezvous and docking procedures.

title: STS-81 Atlantis Docks with Mir
description: Space Shuttle Atlantis docked with the Russian Mir space station during mission STS-81, continuing joint space operations.

title: Discovery of Eris
description: Astronomers announced the discovery of Eris, a dwarf planet larger than Pluto, which contributed to Pluto's reclassification.

title: Soyuz 5 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Soyuz 5, which docked with Soyuz 4 and performed a crew transfer, marking a significant step in space rendezvous.

title: First Woman Cosmonaut
description: Valentina Tereshkova, the first woman in space, was selected as a cosmonaut, paving the way for future female space explorers.

title: Huygens Probe Data Received
description: The first data and images from the Huygens probe's landing on Titan were successfully received by scientists on Earth.

title: Cosmos 104 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 104, a reconnaissance satellite, as part of its extensive Cosmos program.

title: First Space Station Crew
description: The crew of Soyuz 11, the first to inhabit a space station (Salyut 1), returned to Earth after a record-breaking stay.

title: Huygens Probe Explores Titan
description: The Huygens probe transmitted data for over 90 minutes from the surface of Titan, revealing a complex, Earth-like landscape.

title: Soyuz 4 and 5 Undock
description: Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 undocked after their historic crew transfer, marking a successful demonstration of orbital operations.

title: Apollo 17 Returns to Earth
description: Apollo 17, the final Apollo lunar mission, successfully splashed down in the Pacific Ocean, concluding human exploration of the Moon.

title: Stardust Capsule Returns
description: The Stardust mission's sample return capsule successfully landed in Utah, bringing back comet and interstellar dust particles.

title: First Crew Transfer in Orbit
description: Cosmonauts from Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 performed the first-ever transfer between two spacecraft in orbit.

title: STS-61C Columbia Launched
description: Space Shuttle Columbia launched on mission STS-61C, carrying a crew of seven, including Congressman Bill Nelson.

title: Opportunity Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Opportunity rover successfully landed on Mars, beginning its mission to explore the planet's surface for signs of water.

title: B-52 Crash with H-Bombs
description: A B-52 bomber carrying four hydrogen bombs crashed over Palomares, Spain, leading to a complex recovery operation.

title: Soyuz 27 Returns
description: Soyuz 27 returned to Earth with its crew, having completed a mission to the Salyut 6 space station.

title: New Horizons First Light
description: The New Horizons spacecraft captured its first images of Jupiter, demonstrating its imaging capabilities en route to Pluto.

title: First Docking of Crewed Spacecraft
description: The Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 missions completed the first docking of two crewed spacecraft in Earth orbit.

title: STS-61C Columbia Lands
description: Space Shuttle Columbia successfully landed, concluding mission STS-61C, which had been delayed multiple times.

title: Opportunity Rover Begins Exploration
description: After landing, the Opportunity rover began its scientific investigations of the Martian surface, finding evidence of past water.

title: Soyuz 4 and 5 Return
description: The Soyuz 4 and Soyuz 5 spacecraft returned to Earth, completing their historic joint mission.

title: Challenger Disaster Briefing
description: NASA held a press briefing regarding the upcoming STS-51L Challenger mission, which would tragically fail days later.

title: New Horizons Passes Mars Orbit
description: The New Horizons spacecraft crossed the orbit of Mars, continuing its journey to the outer solar system.

title: Progress 1 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Progress 1, the first uncrewed Progress cargo spacecraft, to resupply the Salyut 6 space station.

title: Voyager 2 Uranus Flyby
description: NASA's Voyager 2 spacecraft made its closest approach to Uranus, providing the first detailed images and data of the ice giant.

title: Opportunity Rover Finds Hematite
description: The Opportunity rover discovered spherical concretions of hematite on Mars, strong evidence of past liquid water.

title: Little Joe 1B Launched
description: NASA launched Little Joe 1B, an uncrewed test flight of the Mercury capsule with a rhesus monkey named Miss Sam aboard.

title: Progress 1 Docks with Salyut 6
description: Progress 1 successfully docked with the Salyut 6 space station, delivering supplies to the orbiting crew.

title: Opportunity Rover Explores Meridiani Planum
description: The Opportunity rover began its extensive exploration of Meridiani Planum, a region on Mars believed to have once held water.

title: Ranger 3 Impact Attempt
description: Ranger 3, intended to impact the Moon, passed by the Moon at a distance of about 36,793 km.

title: Discovery of Rings of Uranus
description: Astronomers discovered the rings of Uranus during an occultation of a star by the planet, confirming their existence.

title: Columbia Accident Investigation Board
description: The Columbia Accident Investigation Board (CAIB) was formed to investigate the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster.

title: First US Manned Space Flight
description: NASA announced the selection of the Mercury Seven astronauts, preparing for the first American human spaceflight.

title: STS-51L Challenger Pre-Launch
description: The Space Shuttle Challenger was on the launch pad, preparing for mission STS-51L, which would end in tragedy.

title: New Horizons Jupiter Encounter
description: New Horizons began its closest approach to Jupiter, using the planet's gravity for a slingshot maneuver to Pluto.

title: Voyager 2 Discovers New Moons of Uranus
description: During its Uranus flyby, Voyager 2 discovered several new moons, including Cordelia and Ophelia.

title: STS-32 Columbia Launched
description: Space Shuttle Columbia launched on mission STS-32, deploying the Syncom IV-5 communications satellite.

title: Opportunity Rover Finds Evidence of Water
description: NASA announced that the Opportunity rover found strong evidence that liquid water once flowed on Mars.

title: Mercury-Redstone 2 Launched
description: NASA launched Mercury-Redstone 2, carrying Ham the chimpanzee, a successful suborbital test flight.

title: Voyager 2 Closest Approach to Uranus
description: Voyager 2 made its closest approach to Uranus, passing within 81,500 km of the planet's cloud tops.

title: Opportunity Rover Explores Eagle Crater
description: The Opportunity rover began exploring Eagle Crater, finding layered bedrock that suggested a watery past.

title: Ranger 4 Launched
description: NASA launched Ranger 4, an uncrewed lunar probe, which successfully impacted the far side of the Moon.

title: Salyut 6 Crew Returns
description: The crew of Soyuz 26 returned to Earth after a record-breaking 96-day stay aboard the Salyut 6 space station.

title: Opportunity Rover Finds Jarosite
description: The Opportunity rover detected jarosite, a mineral that forms in the presence of water, further supporting the wet past of Mars.

title: Apollo 1 Fire
description: A flash fire during a launch rehearsal for Apollo 1 tragically killed astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White, and Roger Chaffee.

title: STS-51L Challenger Launch Delayed
description: The launch of Space Shuttle Challenger on mission STS-51L was delayed due to a faulty hatch microswitch.

title: Columbia Crew Prepares for Landing
description: The crew of Space Shuttle Columbia on mission STS-107 was preparing for their return to Earth.

title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
description: The Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds after launch, killing all seven astronauts aboard.

title: STS-89 Endeavour Docks with Mir
description: Space Shuttle Endeavour docked with the Mir space station, exchanging astronauts and transferring supplies.

title: Opportunity Rover Finds Evidence of Ancient Water
description: NASA announced that the Opportunity rover found strong evidence of a past watery environment on Mars, including layered bedrock.

title: Saturn I SA-5 Launched
description: NASA launched Saturn I SA-5, the first flight of the Block II Saturn I rocket and the first to carry a live S-IV second stage.

title: President Reagan Addresses Challenger Disaster
description: President Ronald Reagan delivered a televised address to the nation following the Space Shuttle Challenger disaster.

title: STS-107 Columbia Mission Continues
description: The Space Shuttle Columbia crew continued their scientific experiments in orbit, unaware of the impending disaster.

title: Ranger 6 Launched
description: NASA launched Ranger 6, an uncrewed lunar probe designed to transmit high-resolution images of the Moon's surface.

title: Apollo 14 Launched
description: Apollo 14, the third mission to land humans on the Moon, launched with Alan Shepard, Stuart Roosa, and Edgar Mitchell.

title: STS-107 Columbia Final Day
description: The Space Shuttle Columbia crew completed their final experiments and prepared for reentry the following day.

title: Explorer 1 Launched
description: The United States launched its first artificial satellite, Explorer 1, in response to Sputnik 1.

title: Ham the Chimp in Space
description: Ham, a chimpanzee, became the first hominid in space, paving the way for human spaceflight.

title: Apollo 14 Lands on Moon
description: Apollo 14's lunar module 'Antares' successfully landed on the Moon, with Alan Shepard and Edgar Mitchell aboard.

title: Space Shuttle Columbia Disaster
description: The Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated upon reentry, killing all seven astronauts aboard.

title: Ranger 6 Impacts Moon
description: NASA's Ranger 6 spacecraft successfully impacted the Moon, though its cameras failed to transmit images.

title: Apollo 14 EVA 1
description: Alan Shepard and Edgar Mitchell performed their first extravehicular activity (EVA) on the lunar surface.

title: Vanguard 2 Launched
description: The United States launched Vanguard 2, a satellite designed to measure cloud cover distribution.

title: Apollo 14 EVA 2
description: Shepard and Mitchell conducted their second EVA, exploring the Fra Mauro formation and hitting golf balls on the Moon.

title: Columbia Debris Recovery
description: Search and recovery efforts began across Texas and Louisiana for debris from the Space Shuttle Columbia.

title: Luna 9 Soft Lands on Moon
description: The Soviet Union's Luna 9 became the first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Moon and transmit images from its surface.

title: Apollo 14 Returns to Earth
description: Apollo 14 successfully splashed down in the Pacific Ocean, concluding the third human lunar landing mission.

title: Mars Express Continues Mission
description: The European Space Agency's Mars Express orbiter continued its mission to study the Martian atmosphere and surface.

title: Apollo 14 Rock Samples
description: The Apollo 14 crew returned with 42 kg of lunar rock and soil samples, providing new insights into lunar geology.

title: First Untethered Spacewalk
description: Bruce McCandless II performed the first untethered spacewalk using the Manned Maneuvering Unit (MMU) during STS-41B.

title: Hayabusa Mission Continues
description: Japan's Hayabusa spacecraft continued its journey to asteroid Itokawa to collect samples.

title: Echo 2 Launched
description: NASA launched Echo 2, a large inflatable passive communications satellite, used for bouncing radio signals.

title: Apollo 14 Lunar Module Departs
description: The Apollo 14 lunar module 'Antares' lifted off from the Moon, rejoining the command module in orbit.

title: NASA Establishes Return to Flight Task Group
description: Following the Columbia disaster, NASA established a task group to oversee the Space Shuttle's return to flight.

title: Apollo 14 Lunar Samples
description: The Apollo 14 crew continued to analyze lunar samples, including the 'Genesis Rock', believed to be very old.

title: STS-41B Challenger Launched
description: Space Shuttle Challenger launched on mission STS-41B, featuring the first untethered spacewalk.

title: Mars Odyssey Continues Mapping
description: NASA's Mars Odyssey orbiter continued its mission to map the surface of Mars and search for water ice.

title: First Untethered Spacewalk
description: Astronaut Bruce McCandless II performed the first untethered spacewalk, floating freely in space.

title: STS-96 Discovery Launched
description: Space Shuttle Discovery launched on mission STS-96, a logistics and resupply mission to the International Space Station.

title: STS-122 Atlantis Launched
description: Space Shuttle Atlantis launched on mission STS-122, delivering the European Columbus laboratory to the ISS.

title: Zond 6 Returns
description: The Soviet Zond 6 spacecraft, an uncrewed test flight for a circumlunar mission, returned to Earth.

title: Skylab 4 Crew Returns
description: The Skylab 4 crew returned to Earth after a record-breaking 84-day stay aboard the Skylab space station.

title: Columbus Module Installed on ISS
description: The European Columbus laboratory module was successfully installed on the International Space Station.

title: Apollo 9 Launched
description: NASA launched Apollo 9, the first crewed flight test of the Lunar Module in Earth orbit.

title: Apollo 14 Lunar Samples Analysis
description: Scientists continued detailed analysis of the lunar samples brought back by Apollo 14, including the 'Genesis Rock'.

title: ISS Expands with Columbus
description: The International Space Station significantly expanded its scientific capabilities with the addition of the Columbus module.

title: Telstar 1 Launched
description: NASA launched Telstar 1, the first privately sponsored satellite and the first to relay television signals across the Atlantic.

title: Apollo 14 Crew Debriefing
description: The Apollo 14 crew began their post-flight debriefing, sharing their experiences and observations from the lunar mission.

title: Satellite Collision in Orbit
description: A defunct Russian satellite collided with an active Iridium communications satellite, creating thousands of pieces of space debris.

title: Ohsumi Launched
description: Japan launched Ohsumi, its first artificial satellite, becoming the fourth nation to independently launch a satellite into orbit.

title: STS-41B Challenger Lands
description: Space Shuttle Challenger successfully landed, concluding mission STS-41B, which featured the first untethered spacewalk.

title: Solar Dynamics Observatory Launched
description: NASA launched the Solar Dynamics Observatory (SDO), a mission to study the Sun's influence on Earth and space.

title: Venera 1 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Venera 1, the first spacecraft designed to fly past Venus, though contact was lost en route.

title: Apollo 9 Lunar Module Test
description: The Apollo 9 crew performed the first crewed flight test of the Lunar Module in Earth orbit, including a rendezvous and docking.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Lands on Eros
description: NASA's NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft successfully landed on asteroid Eros, becoming the first spacecraft to land on an asteroid.

title: Cosmos 107 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 107, another satellite in its extensive Cosmos program.

title: Apollo 14 Quarantine Ends
description: The Apollo 14 crew completed their post-flight quarantine, confirming no lunar pathogens were brought back.

title: STS-122 Atlantis Lands
description: Space Shuttle Atlantis successfully landed, concluding mission STS-122, which delivered the Columbus module to the ISS.

title: Pale Blue Dot Image
description: Voyager 1 took the iconic 'Pale Blue Dot' image of Earth from 6 billion kilometers away, at Carl Sagan's request.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Orbits Eros
description: NASA's NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft successfully entered orbit around asteroid 433 Eros, becoming the first spacecraft to orbit an asteroid.

title: Rosetta Probe Orbits Comet
description: The European Space Agency's Rosetta spacecraft successfully entered orbit around Comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko.

title: Ranger 8 Launched
description: NASA launched Ranger 8, an uncrewed lunar probe designed to transmit high-resolution images of the Moon's surface.

title: Apollo 14 Crew Debriefing Concludes
description: The Apollo 14 crew completed their extensive post-flight debriefing, sharing all mission details.

title: Chelyabinsk Meteor Event
description: A superbolide meteor exploded over Chelyabinsk, Russia, injuring over 1,000 people and causing widespread damage.

title: Ranger 8 Impacts Moon
description: NASA's Ranger 8 spacecraft successfully impacted the Moon, transmitting over 7,000 images before impact.

title: Luna 20 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Luna 20, an uncrewed sample return mission to the Moon.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Orbits Eros
description: NEAR Shoemaker became the first spacecraft to orbit an asteroid, providing unprecedented close-up views of Eros.

title: Ranger 8 Images
description: The images from Ranger 8 provided valuable data for future Apollo landing sites.

title: Luna 20 Lands on Moon
description: Luna 20 successfully soft-landed on the Moon, becoming the second Soviet probe to return lunar samples.

title: STS-119 Discovery Launched
description: Space Shuttle Discovery launched on mission STS-119, delivering the final set of solar array wings to the ISS.

title: Pluto Discovered
description: Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at the Lowell Observatory, initially classified as the ninth planet.

title: Luna 20 Returns Samples
description: Luna 20's return capsule successfully landed in Kazakhstan, bringing back lunar soil samples.

title: Perseverance Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully landed in Jezero Crater on Mars, beginning its search for signs of ancient microbial life.

title: Cosmos 54 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 54, a reconnaissance satellite.

title: Luna 20 Lunar Samples
description: The lunar samples returned by Luna 20 provided valuable data on the Moon's highlands.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Orbits Eros
description: NEAR Shoemaker became the first spacecraft to orbit an asteroid, providing detailed images and data of Eros.

title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
description: John Glenn became the first American to orbit Earth aboard the Friendship 7 spacecraft.

title: Ranger 9 Launched
description: NASA launched Ranger 9, the final uncrewed lunar probe in the Ranger program, designed to transmit high-resolution images.

title: Mars Odyssey Arrives at Mars
description: NASA's Mars Odyssey spacecraft successfully entered orbit around Mars, beginning its mission to map the planet.

title: Soyuz 1 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Soyuz 1, a crewed mission that ended tragically with the death of cosmonaut Vladimir Komarov.

title: Luna 20 Sample Analysis
description: Scientists began detailed analysis of the lunar samples returned by Luna 20, focusing on their composition and age.

title: Mars Odyssey Finds Evidence of Water Ice
description: Early data from Mars Odyssey indicated the presence of large amounts of water ice just beneath the Martian surface.

title: Cosmos 109 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 109, another satellite in its Cosmos program.

title: First US Space Station
description: NASA announced plans for a permanent space station, which would eventually become the International Space Station.

title: TRAPPIST-1 System Discovered
description: NASA announced the discovery of seven Earth-sized exoplanets orbiting the star TRAPPIST-1, three of which are in the habitable zone.

title: Ranger 9 Impacts Moon
description: NASA's Ranger 9 spacecraft successfully impacted the Moon, transmitting live images to television audiences.

title: Soyuz 28 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Soyuz 28, carrying the first Czechoslovak and German cosmonauts to Salyut 6.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Ends Mission
description: NEAR Shoemaker was shut down after successfully landing on Eros and transmitting data for over a year.

title: Cosmos 110 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 110, carrying two dogs, Veterok and Ugolyok, on a 22-day orbital flight.

title: Soyuz 28 Docks with Salyut 6
description: Soyuz 28 successfully docked with the Salyut 6 space station, beginning a joint international mission.

title: Dawn Spacecraft Arrives at Ceres
description: NASA's Dawn spacecraft successfully entered orbit around the dwarf planet Ceres, becoming the first mission to orbit two extraterrestrial bodies.

title: Dogs in Space
description: Veterok and Ugolyok, two dogs, completed a record-breaking 22-day orbital flight aboard Cosmos 110.

title: Soyuz 28 Crew Begins Experiments
description: The international crew of Soyuz 28 began their scientific experiments aboard the Salyut 6 space station.

title: Dawn Begins Ceres Mapping
description: The Dawn spacecraft began its detailed mapping of Ceres, revealing its unique surface features.

title: Luna 9 Images Released
description: The first panoramic images from the surface of the Moon, taken by Luna 9, were released to the public.

title: First Czechoslovak in Space
description: Vladimír Remek became the first Czechoslovak cosmonaut, flying aboard Soyuz 28.

title: DSCOVR Launched
description: NASA launched the Deep Space Climate Observatory (DSCOVR), a satellite to monitor solar wind and Earth's climate.

title: Venera 3 Impacts Venus
description: The Soviet Venera 3 spacecraft impacted Venus, becoming the first spacecraft to reach the surface of another planet.

title: Soyuz 28 Experiments
description: The Soyuz 28 crew continued their joint scientific program with the Salyut 6 crew.

title: Dawn Images of Ceres
description: Early images from Dawn revealed intriguing features on Ceres, including bright spots in Occator Crater.

title: Discoverer 1 Launched
description: The United States launched Discoverer 1, the first satellite launched into a polar orbit.

title: First German in Space
description: Sigmund Jähn became the first German cosmonaut, flying aboard Soyuz 28.

title: Falcon Heavy Demo Flight
description: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy rocket completed its maiden flight, launching a Tesla Roadster into space.

title: Discoverer 9 Launched
description: The United States launched Discoverer 9, part of a series of reconnaissance satellites.

title: Luna 20 Sample Distribution
description: Lunar samples from Luna 20 were distributed to scientists for further analysis.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Data Analysis
description: Scientists continued to analyze data from NEAR Shoemaker's orbit around Eros, revealing its surface features and composition.

title: Venera 3 Impacts Venus
description: The Soviet Venera 3 probe became the first spacecraft to impact the surface of another planet (Venus).

title: Soyuz 28 Returns
description: Soyuz 28 returned to Earth, concluding the first international mission to the Salyut 6 space station.

title: Mars Odyssey Finds More Water Ice
description: NASA's Mars Odyssey orbiter provided stronger evidence of vast quantities of water ice near the Martian poles.

title: Pioneer 10 Launched
description: NASA launched Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make direct observations of Jupiter.

title: First International Crew on Salyut 6
description: The Soyuz 28 mission marked the first time an international crew visited the Salyut 6 space station.

title: Rosetta Launched
description: The European Space Agency launched Rosetta, a spacecraft designed to rendezvous with and land on a comet.

title: Apollo 9 Returns to Earth
description: Apollo 9 successfully splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean, concluding the first crewed test of the Lunar Module.

title: Pioneer 10 Begins Journey
description: Pioneer 10 began its historic journey to Jupiter, becoming the first spacecraft to leave the inner solar system.

title: Rosetta Begins Journey to Comet
description: Rosetta began its 10-year journey to Comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko.

title: Cosmos 111 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 111, an attempted lunar orbiter that failed to reach lunar orbit.

title: Voyager 1 Jupiter Flyby
description: NASA's Voyager 1 spacecraft made its closest approach to Jupiter, providing stunning images and data of the gas giant and its moons.

title: Deep Impact Extended Mission
description: NASA announced an extended mission for Deep Impact, targeting other comets and asteroids.

title: Voyager 1 Discovers New Moons of Jupiter
description: During its Jupiter flyby, Voyager 1 discovered Thebe and Metis, two of Jupiter's inner moons.

title: STS-3 Columbia Launched
description: Space Shuttle Columbia launched on mission STS-3, the third test flight of the Space Shuttle program.

title: Dawn Spacecraft Orbits Ceres
description: NASA's Dawn spacecraft successfully entered orbit around the dwarf planet Ceres, becoming the first mission to orbit two extraterrestrial bodies.

title: Pioneer 10 Launched
description: NASA launched Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make direct observations of Jupiter.

title: Voyager 1 Explores Jupiter's Moons
description: Voyager 1 provided detailed images of Jupiter's Galilean moons, revealing their unique geological features.

title: Kepler Space Telescope Launched
description: NASA launched the Kepler Space Telescope, a mission dedicated to discovering exoplanets, particularly Earth-sized planets in habitable zones.

title: OSCAR 1 Launched
description: The first amateur radio satellite, OSCAR 1, was launched, built by Project OSCAR, Inc.

title: Voyager 1 Discovers Jupiter's Ring
description: Voyager 1 discovered Jupiter's faint ring system, a surprising finding for the gas giant.

title: Kepler Begins Exoplanet Hunt
description: The Kepler Space Telescope began its mission to search for exoplanets using the transit method.

title: First US Spacewalk
description: Alexey Leonov performed the first spacewalk, exiting the Voskhod 2 spacecraft.

title: Voyager 1 Departs Jupiter
description: Voyager 1 completed its Jupiter flyby and began its journey towards Saturn.

title: Opportunity Rover Finds Evidence of Water
description: NASA announced that the Opportunity rover found strong evidence that liquid water once flowed on Mars.

title: Sputnik 9 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 9, carrying a dog, a guinea pig, and mice, as a test for human spaceflight.

title: Voyager 1 Images of Io
description: Voyager 1 captured detailed images of Jupiter's moon Io, revealing active volcanism, a major discovery.

title: Rosetta Continues Journey
description: The Rosetta spacecraft continued its long journey through the solar system towards Comet 67P.

title: Venera 4 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Venera 4, a probe designed to enter the atmosphere of Venus.

title: First Space Shuttle Enterprise Rollout
description: The Space Shuttle Enterprise, the first orbiter, was rolled out of the assembly plant, marking a new era for NASA.

title: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Arrives
description: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter successfully entered orbit around Mars, beginning its mission to study the planet's geology and climate.

title: Sputnik 10 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 10, carrying a dog, a dummy cosmonaut, and other biological specimens.

title: Voyager 1 Explores Europa
description: Voyager 1 captured detailed images of Jupiter's moon Europa, revealing its smooth, icy surface and potential subsurface ocean.

title: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Begins Aerobraking
description: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter began its aerobraking phase to gradually lower its orbit around Mars.

title: Voskhod 2 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched Voskhod 2, carrying Pavel Belyayev and Alexey Leonov, who performed the first spacewalk.

title: Voyager 1 Images of Ganymede
description: Voyager 1 captured images of Jupiter's moon Ganymede, revealing its complex surface with grooves and craters.

title: Rosetta Performs Earth Flyby
description: The Rosetta spacecraft performed its first Earth flyby, using the planet's gravity to gain speed for its journey.

title: Uranus Discovered
description: William Herschel discovered Uranus, initially believing it to be a comet, but later confirmed as a planet.

title: First Spacewalk by Alexey Leonov
description: Alexey Leonov performed the first spacewalk, spending 12 minutes outside the Voskhod 2 spacecraft.

title: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Continues Aerobraking
